  • Method Details

    • begin

      public boolean begin (Window window, FileSystem fileSystem)
      Start the ICWars game. Can fail (return false).

      It does these things, in this order:

      • Call AreaGame.begin(Window, FileSystem).
      • Get the keyboard.
      • Initialise and then call AreaGame.addArea(Area) on all of the levels in ICWars.
      • Call nextArea() to set AreaGame.currentArea to the first level, then initialise it.
      Specified by:
      begin in interface Playable
      Overrides:
      begin in class AreaGame
      Parameters:
      window - The Window that the game is displayed in.
      fileSystem - The FileSystem that the game gets its visual resources from.
      Returns:
      true if the game successfully started.

      private void initArea()
      Overloads initArea(ICWarsArea).

      Call initArea on the currentArea.

      protected boolean nextArea()
      TODO
      Overrides:
      nextArea in class AreaGame
      Returns:

    • initArea

      private void initArea (ICWarsArea area)

      Initialise an ICWarsArea by:

      • initialising the ICWarsPlayers and their units;
      • adding each player to the players list and making then enter the area;
      • Setting gameState to INIT
      Parameters:
      area - The ICWarsArea object to initialise.

    • processKeyboardInput

      private void processKeyboardInput()
      Process all the input keys.

    • update

      public void update (float deltaTime)
      First calls processKeyboardInput(), then, depending on the current gameState, update the game accordingly. Then call AreaGame.update(float).
      Specified by:
      update in interface Updatable
      Overrides:
      update in class AreaGame
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time since the last call to this function.

    • removeDefeatedPlayers

      private void removeDefeatedPlayers()

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Returns the title of the ICWars game.
      Returns:
      Currently "ICWars"

    • close

      public void close()
      No-op. Used to implement AutoCloseable.
